Key Match Events: Derrick White had 23 points and Jayson Tatum and Payton Pritchard added 20 each to lead the Boston Celtics to a 109-86 victory over the Houston Rockets.
The Celtics led by 10 after three and scored the first 11 points of the fourth quarter to push their advantage to 93-72.
White, Kristaps Porzingis and Pritchard made 3s in that stretch to help the Celtics pull away for their third straight victory.
Jalen Green had 27 points for the Rockets.
Pre-Game Insights: Coach Joe Mazzulla cleared the bench with Boston up by 21 points with about 4 1/2 minutes to go.
Sam Hauser, who had 15 points Thursday night filling in for Jaylen Brown, didn't score Friday night.
Amen Thompson, the fourth pick in the 2023 draft, will fill in for Jeff Green moving forward after finishing up a two-game suspension Friday night for a fight with Miamiâ€™s Tyler Herro last weekend.
Post-Match Reflections: Porzingis added 11 points with five rebounds in his return after missing four games with a sprained left ankle.
The Celtics visit Oklahoma City on Sunday, and the Rockets host the Los Angeles Lakers on Sunday night.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Boston had no trouble handling Houston despite playing without Jaylen Brown, who missed a second straight game with a shoulder strain.
The Rockets made just 32 of 88 shots with Green going 10 of 21 and Cam Whitmore making just 4 of 17.
